title: Pound Ridge Golf Club, Delamar Greenwich Harbor announce continuation of Stay-and-Play Experience
text:
Pound Ridge Golf Club, Delamar Greenwich Harbor announce continuation of Stay-and-Play Experience Pound Ridge Golf Club, Delamar Greenwich Harbor announce continuation of Stay-and-Play Experience Details Category: Hotel Created on Wednesday, 19 August 2015 09:45 Pound Ridge Golf Club – New York’s only Pete Dye design – and the luxurious Delamar Greenwich Harbor, announce the continuation of their popular stay-and-play experience. The package is offered seven days a week and includes one round of golf per person and one night’s accommodations. Weekday rates start at $455, weekends at $499 (single occupancy). 
Value-laden additions include: • Golf shoe and club rental • 10% off all golf shop merchandise at Pound Ridge Golf Club • A bottle of champagne/wine delivered to the room • 10% off a sports massage at the Spa at Delamar “Our full bentgrass course is in optimal condition in the late summer and early fall as we experience cooler nights,” says Todd Leavenworth, General Manager. “Overall, it is a wonderful time to visit the region, and the Delmar’s maritime setting and five-star service is the perfect complement to our unique, Dye-designed layout.” Pound Ridge is situated less than an hour from New York City and only minutes from the Stanford, Greenwich, and Norwalk, Connecticut. Ranked among the top five courses in New York by GOLF Magazine and Golfweek, Men’s Journal dubbed the course “a modern masterpiece.” Surrounded by a sea of traditional, private clubs, Pound Ridge stands out as a testament to Dye’s progressive design techniques and owner Ken Wang’s commitment to daily fee golf. The Delamar Greenwich Harbor features 82 deluxe rooms and suites with 500-feet of waterfront and private docks. Designed to evoke old world charm, it houses a full service spa with services and treatments by the luxury brands Biologique Recherche and Valmont, and an award-winning restaurant and bar, L'escale. Wrought iron balconies, marble bathrooms and working fireplaces grace the guest rooms of this Mediterranean-inspired “inn.” Guests enjoy tee time booking via concierge or hotel staff and transportation options (from shuttles to rental cars and limousines).
